Experience Summer Associate J.P. Morgan June 2014  –  August 2014  (3 months) Greater New York City Area Director of Development and Consultant Life Sciences Foundation May 2011  –  January 2013  (1 year 9 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Managed day-to-day fundraising and finance operations for the Life Sciences Foundation, a non-profit organization dedicated to chronicling the history of biotechnology for use by scholars, members of the finance community and educators. 
• Provided direction and support to the President and Board related to performance management, recruiting, staff development and compensation including developing equity increase recommendations and facilitating compensation discussions. 
• Performed cash flow analysis on the burn rate of the foundation alongside expected gifts and ensured payroll would be met. 
• Raised $1.6M including gifts of $100,000 to $500,000 in seed funding from pharmaceutical corporations, former biotechnology executives and venture capitalists focused on life science investing to launch the foundation. 
• Developed personal relationships with donors and prospects, with a focus on biotechnology pioneers. 
• Researched data for proposal development for corporate gifts and developed relationships with key industry leaders.  
• Represented the foundation at biotechnology conferences and local trade organization events to communicate the goals and priorities of the foundation and identify individual and corporate fundraising opportunities. 
• Launched the New England and San Diego Chapters of the foundation to expand the foundation’s message in the major markets of biotechnology activity, broaden the foundation’s funding base and identify key leadership in each region. Board of Directors CARA October 2010  –  December 2012  (2 years 3 months) Associate Director of Development Stanford University February 2008  –  January 2011  (3 years) Stanford, CA • Reviewed 10-Ks, S-1s and Form 4s to perform net worth assessments to identify high net worth alumni of Stanford. 
• Actively consulted major gift fundraising staff on high net worth alumni and participated in gift strategy discussions. 
• Provided biographical and financial information on new prospects, and advised fundraisers on cultivation and solicitations. 
• Analyzed market fundamentals and led capital markets research to consult the major and principal gift fundraising team on lucrative industries, recent IPOs, M&A activity and executive transitions to identify prospects with major gift capacity. 
• Conducted a three-part training series aimed at educating the fundraising staff on how to use Blackbaud, a modeling and data analytics provider, and identified 2,500 new prospects. 
• Managed five associates providing training, promoting career development and guiding them through organizational change. Client Relations Associate and Research Assistant Standard Pacific Capital December 2005  –  December 2007  (2 years 1 month) • Developed the firm's relationships with clients, brokers and institutional partners. 
• Conducted research on portfolio companies in the technology and beverages industries. 
• Prepared and edited monthly and quarterly investor letters amalgamating portfolio strategy and outlook across the funds. Financial Analyst and Assistant Director of Development Stanford University March 2002  –  December 2005  (3 years 10 months) • Created a model to identify prospects in the investment banking industry resulting in the identification of 1,200 new prospects, representing a 300% increase, with the capacity to make a gift of $250,000 or more, and worked directly with senior staff and trustees to garner validation of methodology.  
• Initiated aggressive fundraising efforts in Mexico and South America by consulting the Dean and Associated Dean of the Graduate School of Business on key families in the region with capacity of $1 million or more. Assistant to the Director of Government Debt Bulgarian Ministry of Finance July 2000  –  August 2000  (2 months) Sofia, Bulgaria • Conducted an assessment of the country's capital markets by meeting with leaders in Bulgaria’s finance community including leaders from the Bulgarian Stock Exchange, international investment banks, and the U.S. Agency for International Development and proposed recommendations to the Director of Government Debt on how the country could bolster investment in its stock exchange. Auditor KPMG June 1998  –  July 1999  (1 year 2 months) • Served on the audit team for a comprehensive review of the inventory accounting systems for the U.S. Department of Defense. Staff Assistant United States Senate September 1997  –  February 1998  (6 months) Intern U.S. Department of Education June 1997  –  August 1997  (3 months) Intern KPMG US June 1996  –  September 1996  (4 months) • Interned in the financial services practice in the Los Angeles office serving a major national bank and real estate development firm. Summary Litigator with experience managing all stages of litigation in complex commercial, securities, patent, and trade secret, and consumer class actions in federal and state courts, conducting internal investigations, advising clients on litigation risks and compliance, and representing clients in government investigations.
